newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: AWB Australia wheat indicator prices - May 23.
newsitem.headline: AWB Australia wheat indicator prices - May 23.

text.p: Australian Wheat Board international card prices for wheat exports for May 23.
In U.S. dollars per tonne, FOB eastern states.
ASW AH PH 13 PCT PH 14 PCT
Note: ASW = Australian Standard White; AH = Australian Hard; PH = Australian Prime Hard; percentages = protein content.
Australian Wheat Board indicator prices for multi-grade contracts for 1997/98 crop wheat increased A$2.00 per tonne.
Indicator Prices in A$ per tonne:
Indicator prices on a delivered port basis: Queensland South Australia
AWB MARKET COMMENTARY: World wheat prices were lower overnight as the Australian dollar rallied sharply.

NOTE: The indicator price represents the current state of the international wheat market. It is a cash contract fob price quoted on a delivered port basis, offered today by the AWB for wheat delivered during the 1997/98 harvest. The offer is valid until 4.30 p.m. Australian Eastern Standard Time (0630 GMT).
